section.header: Sense of the Senate regarding the commutation of the death sentence of Anthony George Battle granted by President Biden on December 23, 2024
section.text: It is the sense of the Senate that—

paragraph.text: President Joseph R. Biden undermined the rule of law and robbed victims of justice when he commuted the death sentence of Anthony George Battle on December 23, 2024;
Anthony Battle was convicted of murdering his wife, a U.S. Marine, and sentenced to life imprisonment;

while Battle was serving his life sentence at Atlanta Federal Penitentiary, he murdered a 31-year-old correctional officer named D’Antonio Washington by bludgeoning Washington in the back of the head repeatedly with a ball-peen hammer;
when Battle was questioned by investigators, he had no remorse and stated that he was happy he killed Washington;
this commutation is a reprehensible insult to the victims of Anthony Battle;

President Biden claimed that he commuted the death sentences of Anthony Battle and 36 other murderers out of a principled opposition to the death penalty but refused to commute the death sentences of the 3 most controversial death row inmates, demonstrating that President Biden was motivated by politics, not principles; and
the Senate unequivocally condemns this commutation.
